column1: short of a length, angled into the pads, worked backward of square
fuller, outside off, driven firmly to the covers and there's a superb save by McDermott
gets the line wrong, and clears deep square with a strong flick off his pads, just has the legs to clear the man on the rope. Similar to how he fell in the ODI series in Adelaide
outside off, full, he comes forward and drives between cover and point
hammered! Offers up some width outside off, Hendricks drives on the up. Powerful
length ball angled across, a swing and a miss...handy first over for South Africa
over the wicket, full at off stump, swung without much footwork through the leg side
142kph, pushed down the leg side
back of a length outside off, played to backward point with an open face
a might swing across the line as this slides across outside off
back of a length, taken on the pad as he again aims to leg but that pitched fairly short and must have been outisde leg
crunches a drive off the front foot to mid-off
this time he connects! Full outside off, a lovely swing of the arms, drives up and over mid-off
short of a length, into the hip, he goes for the pull and it glances off the thigh pad to fine leg
short outside off, clubbed through midwicket, this sits up nicely and its a dismissive shot
miles into the stands as he pulls this from back of a length over deep midwicket
and again! He's taking apart some average bowling here, short of a length outside off, Hendricks getting onto the front foot and clubs through midwicket
and then the short ball works! Properly banged in this time, climbs a tough more on Hendricks, takes more top edge than middle out to deep square
length ball at off stump, 115kph, a slower one, angled to backward point
round the wicket, tapped into midwicket
full at the stumps, pushed just to the on side and they steal a quick single
gives himself room outside leg stump and carves this over backward point, a slicing drive
uses his feet and works a straight delivery through midwicket, Faf wanted the second but go sent back
nearly drags this on as he moves outside leg, it's fired in by Maxwell, takes the bottom edge
attempts a reverse sweep, takes the pad into the leg side
starts a touch short, de Kock again moving to the leg side, drives behind point and a slip in the deep allows a third
steps to leg and drills down to long-off
big appeal for lbw as de Kock misses a conventional sweep and Finch calls the review...has it struck him outside the line of off stump? No bat involved. Yes, it's outside the line
finds space, gets some fortune...came down the pitch, done in the air, miscues his lofted drive but it lobs between cover running back and long-off coming in
what power in that! That's a crunching, skimming cover drive which reaches the boundary in the blink of an eye
again he just clears the field, this time it slices off a thick outside edge and clears backward point
flatter, slides under the bottom edge as de Kock comes down the pitch, and offers a simple stumping for Carey
low full toss from round the wicket, sent out to deep midwicket
goes down on his back knee, fetches this from outside off with a slog-sweep to deep square
good work from Maxwell, dives to his right to cut off du Plessis' drive
a full toss, quick, fired across outside off and du Plessis misses. Carey does well to get a pad on it
but Carey can't stop this one, Maxwell firing it in very quickly, this time there's a thin scratch on it as du Plessis tries to heave to the leg side. Wasn't a catch, it nutmegged Carey
full and straight, 147kph, clipped through midwicket and they gamble on a second to Maxwell's arm
that's superbly played, gives himself room outside leg then ramps this over short third man...using Stanlake's pace to his advantage
that's very wide down the leg side, and they steal an extra run as well with Carey unable to prevent it with an under-arm throw
gives himself room and picks out cover as this came off the middle, travelled at a rate of knots to the fielder
down the pitch again, it's a short delivery, swatted into the leg side...tennis-style
a big full toss, just manages to clear mid-on, didn't get it as cleanly as he wanted, came low down off the bat...Coulter-Nile couldn't quite get it with a leap

a brilliant parried boundary catch by Maxwell, we see them pretty often these days but they are still fantastic. This was pulled towards deep midwicket, Maxwell took it just inside the rope and had terrific awareness of where he was, flicks it in the air, jumps over the boundary then back inside to regather the catch
oops, massive full toss, not sure if this was a knuckle ball which slips out. It pitches half way towards Carey as it flies over Miller's head
short, pulled on the bounce to deep midwicket
low full toss at the stumps, clubbed to long-on
very full outside off, drives powerfully towards deep cover, a sliding save around the boundary
a short ball, he goes for the pull and gets a top edge straight back over the keeper
that's a crunching cover drive, but the field is well set with deep cover quite wide...goes straight to him
a slower ball, full outside off, he does very well to get this up and over backward point
round the wicket, a length ball angling in, dabbed to short third man...singles are a good result for the bowling side
a length ball outside off, tries to clear long-on but doesn't connect well enough and finds the man
round the wicket, goes for the wide yorker, driven firmly square to deep point...South Africa's 100
short of a length, a slower ball, defeats the pull and takes him in the stomach
big appeal for lbw as he swings across the line, deflects off the back to short third man. That looked a pretty good shout
goes deep in the crease and sends a short-of-a-length delivery through backward point
carves a wide full toss straight to deep cover, Australia finishing well so far. Miller gave himself a bit of room and ended up having to reach a long way for it
a low full toss is heaved down to long-on
that goes a bit wrong, dragged very wide outside off
full outside off, big swing, thin edge, comfortable catch...the big build-up for Morris and he bags a golden
full toss outside off, driven out to deep cover who can't stop the second on the big outfield
back of a length, angled across outside off, he'll be annoyed he missed out on that
and another fresh air shot, swings across the line of a back-of-a-length delivery. Superb final over from Tye
back of a length at off stump, 143kph, worked out to deep midwicket
gets the line wrong, angled into the pads, just takes the thigh guard and it just has the legs to trickle into the boundary
144kph, short of a length, follows Lynn as he aims to pull through the leg side and beats him for pace
misjudgement in the deep! This should have been a catch...Lynn pulls a back-of-a-length delivery towards deep square, Hendricks had come in too far and it lobbed over his head
now he gives himself some room to the leg side, this is fuller and straight, sliced over backward point
very good work from de Kock as he dives full length to cut off this bottom edge as Lynn aims leg side again
comes down the pitch, it's back of a length, he does well to whip this off his pads behind square
short of a length, into the pads, drops down by his feet and Lynn calls him through
a flat-batted swat to a short delivery, goes straight back towards the bowler who can't cut it off

dropped! And another mess-up in the field for South Africa. Three fielders converging and none of them really wanted it. Phehlukwayo the man who ended up dropping it. Finch was followed by a short-of-a-length delivery, sent it very high into midwicket. David Miller, running in off the boundary, may have had a better chance
back of a length at off stump, a rare dot ball
strikes this time! Back of a length, this doesn't bounce much, Finch swings to the leg side and his castled
skims past off stump as Lynn gives himself room to a length delivery
short of a length, a short-arm pull clears mid-on with some ease
hammered dead straight and into the stumps! That's cost him a boundary. Drills his drive off the middle, demolishes the timber

picks out cover first ball! Short won't make an impact, follows his ODI duck in Perth with one here. Full outside off, was there for the shot, nice length for it, but just drove it to the edge of the circle
short of a length, good delivery, nips back at Maxwell who pushes it towards mid-off without much conviction
cleaned him up! What an over from Morris. Gets the yorker bang on. Right at middle stump, Lynn gave himself a touch of room. Tailed in a touch as well, lovely delivery
starts on leg stump and gets tickled away fine, Ngidi makes excellent ground around the rope to flick it back. Brilliant from a fast bowler
pushes down the leg side, hasn't started on the right line
another poor ball, full outside leg stump, he's fortunate Stoinis just flicks this for a single to long leg...would have been a wide
a slower ball, at the stumps, flicked through midwicket
another slower one, full outside off, and this is sent skimming to the cover boundary by a sweetly-struck drive
finds backward point this time! Goes for another drive, not quite as full, this time the face opens a touch and it's sliced in the air. Neat catch above the head
full and straight, flicked to deep midwicket
short outside off, driven down to long-off
short of a length, reverse swept but straight to backward point
goes back in the crease and pulls a flat delivery to deep midwicket
very wide outside off, goes well across his crease and drags a slog-sweep to deep midwicket
another attempt at a reverse sweep, doesn't make contact
pushed wide across outside off, a swing and a miss...not too far from a wide. Just four off the over
steps outside leg stump and swings a length ball to long-on
scooped into the hands of de Kock! But at least he's not run out. Went across his crease, a short-of-a-length delivery, aims to scoop it over the keeper and it runs off the face
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
on off stump, back of a length, opens the face through point
driven through the off side, wide of long-off which allows him back for a second
picks up this slower ball! Maxwell connects well, a full delivery angling in towards leg stump, he brings out the golf swing and clears deep midwicket
he's saved by the fact this slog sweep doesn't come out of the middle, lobs between deep midwicket and long-on
swept to deep midwicket
sweetly struck, lofted straight down the ground, long-on does well to get across
gives himself room to a shorter delivery but it's just a single to long-on
full, can't get underneath it, dragged through midwicket
simple catch to long-off, came down the pitch but couldn't get the distance needed, slow through the air
gets the yorker in but isn't backed up in the field, sliced towards backward point who dives over it
back of a length, follows Maxwell, carved over point. Keeps the strike
full outside off, a slower ball, he's through the shot...perhaps moving around the crease too much
another dot ball, this time a swing to leg against a short-of-a-length delivery
this is superb from Morris, follows him with a short ball which Maxwell tries to ramp down to third man. Crowd want the wide, as does Maxwell. Probably a fair shout, actually
tries for the yorker, just gets it wrong and slips down the leg side

it's all happening! Goes for the yorker, it's a low full toss which is driven to mid-off, almost carries for the catch, du Plessis collects on the half volley and goes for the run out by NCN makes it with a dive
follows him with a back-of-a-length delivery, deflects off the hip to third man
jabs a length delivery into the leg side
and now the follow-up is a dot as he moves outside leg, swings and misses
a shorter delivery, moves across outside off stump, misses the pull but gets the wide call
another short one, makes a connection this time and pulls to fine leg off the glove
gets a top edge and this hoick to leg and it flies to fine leg
follows him with a yorker well outside leg, clipped to deep square
that's sweetly struck, stands much stiller, it's a length delivery and it's lofted well over long-on
full outside off, drilled down the ground
short outside off, he's not too impressed with that wide call
a full ball is speared between leg stump and the pads as he swings to leg
nearly cleans him up as he swings to leg against a length delivery
heaved out to deep midwicket
a big full toss is clubbed down to long-on, the umpires say it's fine for height so it all ends with a wicket
